com.yantra.api.ycd

Interface getCompleteItemList

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCDApi, YIFApi

    public interface getCompleteItemList

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getCompleteItemList(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The getCompleteItemList API acts as a wrapper API for getItemListForOrdering.

    • Method Detail

      • getCompleteItemList

        org.w3c.dom.Document getCompleteItemList(YFSEnvironment env,
                                         org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                  throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                         java.rmi.RemoteException

        The getCompleteItemList API acts as a wrapper API for getItemListForOrdering. All functionality exposed in that API applies to this one as well. This API adds the functionality explained below.

        Searching Based On A Barcode

        If the BarCode element is passed in the input the API will search for items with a matching barcode.

        Prices For Items With Variations

        The computed prices for variations of an item with variations can be returned under the ChildItem element if the ComputedPrice element is passed in the template.

        Item Attribute Information For Bundle Components

        The item attribute information for bundle components can be returned under the Component element according to the template being used.

        UI Visible Associations

        When the HasVisibleAssociations attribute is passed in the template on the Item element this API will determine if the item has an associated items whose association type is visible on the UI.

        Obtaining the distinct attributes and its assigned values across the child items related to a Model Item:

        These details are obtained when the following attributes are passed in the input /Item/ClassificationCodes/@Model and /Item/PrimaryInformation/@ModelItemUnitOfMeasure attributes in the input. The distinct attributes and the assigned values are returned in the XPATH /ItemList/AttributeList/Attribute and /ItemList/AttributeList/Attribute/AssignedValueList/AssignedValue respectively. The attributes and its assigned values will be returned based on the child items that are returned after considering the API input. Example: If there are 100 child items that are associated to a model item and if the API input is in such a way that it returns only 10 child items, then the Attributes and Assigned Values that are returned will be based out of 10 child items.

        The getAttributeDetails API is called to fetch the Image URL. If there are large number of allowed values for attributes and ImageURL is not configured then call to getAttributeDetails API can be avoided by removing ImageURL attribute from the API output template to improve the performance of the getCompleteItemList API.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:

          com.yantra.pca.ycd.japi.ue.YCDOverrideDeliveryMethodForLinesUE
            This user exit is called to determine if any of the delivery methods are overridden for an item.
          Please refer to the getItemListForOrdering API for a list of user exits.

          Events Raised: Please refer to the getItemListForOrdering API for a list of raised events.

          Audits: Please refer to the getItemListForOrdering API for a list of audits.

          Pre-conditions: Please refer to the getItemListForOrdering API for a list of pre-conditions.

          Post-conditions:
          A list of items matching the input criteria are returned, along with additional data based on the template supplied.

          Output Template Support: Yes

          Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains exception data. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
